revisions.rev:
{{Infobox OS | name = Turbolinux | logo = | screenshot = | caption = | website = [http://www.turbolinux.com/ www.turbolinux.com] | developer = Turbolinux | family = [[Unix-like]] | source_model = [[Open source]] | released = | latest_release_version = Turbolinux Client 2008 | latest_release_date = {{release date|2008|8|29}} | latest_test_version = | latest_test_date = | marketing_target = Asian-language users | language = | kernel_type = [[Monolithic kernel|Monolithic]] [[Linux kernel]] | ui = | license = | working_state = | supported_platforms = [[IA-32]], [[x86-64]] | updatemodel = | package_manager = [[RPM Package Manager|RPM]] }} '''Turbolinux''' is a Japanese [[Linux distribution]] targeting Asian users.
==Linux distribution== The Turbolinux distribution was created as a rebranded Red Hat distribution by (then) Pacific HiTech employee Scott Stone. Scott was the lead release engineer through version 3.6.
Turbolinux is notable for including licensed copies of CyberLink [[PowerDVD]] and [[Windows Media]] binary [[codec]]s.<ref>http://www.desktoplinux.com/news/NS9651224512.html</ref>
==Company== Turbolinux (the company) was founded in 1992 as Pacific HiTech in [[Sandy, Utah]] by Cliff and Iris Miller.<ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/19981206005239/pht.com/corporate/index.html About Turbolinux (circa 1999)]</ref>
PHT changed its name to Turbolinux in June 1999 to better identify with its flagship product.
The Millers were "terminated without cause" from Turbolinux in July 2000 <ref>[http://lwn.net/2000/features/Turbolinux-ipo.php3 LWN analysis of Turbolinux IPO prospectus]</ref> after a disagreement with [[venture capitalists]].<ref>[http://www.linux.com/feature/16703 "Bumpy ride continues for Turbolinux: No more package sales in U.S." Linux.com]</ref>
After several rounds of layoffs, Turbolinux sold its name and distribution to Japanese software corporation SRA in September 2002.<ref>[http://www.turbolinux.com/company/news/2002/020820.html SRA buys Turbolinux product and name]</ref> The former headquarters at [[Brisbane, California]] closed its doors shortly thereafter and all operations were relocated to [[Shibuya, Tokyo]], Japan.<ref>[http://www.turbolinux.com/company/aboutcompany.html About Turbolinux (2008)]</ref>
Turbolinux successfully completed an [[IPO]] on the [[Osaka Stock Exchange]] in September 2005<ref>[http://www.turbolinux.com/cgi-bin/newsrelease/index.cgi?date2=20050816125136&mode=syosai IPO announcement]</ref> underwritten by [[Nikko Citigroup]], [[Livedoor]] Securities Co. Ltd., and [[Mizuho]] Investors Securities Co. Ltd.
Turbolinux is a member of the [[Interop Vendor Alliance]].<ref>http://www.linuxelectrons.com/news/linux/15392/turbolinux-joins-microsoft-interop-vendor-alliance</ref><ref>http://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS27821+28-Nov-2007+BW20071128</ref><ref>http://interopvendoralliance.org/Directory.aspx</ref>
